text: David Atkins, OAM David Atkins official website – about us (born 12 December 1955)Melbourne Observer is an Australian dancer, choreographer, music-theatre director and producer. ==Career== ===Stage and television=== Atkins began his performance career aged 12 with a role in the musical Mame. As an adult performer, as well as performing in shows such as A Chorus Line and The Pirates of Penzance, he created and performed in his own works Dancin' Man and Dynamite. ===World events=== Atkins has directed and produced major live events in various countries. These include Victory Ceremonies in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.David Atkins and Vancouver 2010 Opening Ceremonies:Backstagejob ===Honours and awards=== Atkins was recognised in the 2003 Queen's Birthday Honours with a Medal of the Order of Australia (OAM) for his contribution to the Australian entertainment industry. In 2010, the Australian Event Awards presented him with a Lifetime Achievement Award Australian Event Awards — 2010 Official Website for his enduring contributions to the Australian events industry. ==References== ==External links== * David Atkins Enterprises official website Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:Australian male stage actors Category:Australian male film actors Category:Australian male dancers Category:Australian male musical theatre actors Category:Australian theatre directors Category:Helpmann Award winners Category:Laurence Olivier Award winners Category:Recipients of the Medal of the Order of Australia Category:Australian theatre managers and producers
title: David Atkins
